question:
You are a math expert. When you respond, respond only with the Solution of the final Problem, thinking step by step. At the end of the Solution, when you give your final answer, write it in the form 'Final Answer: \\boxed{$answer$}. I hope it is correct.'
The polynomial $f(x)=x^3-3x^2-4x+4$ has three real roots $r_1$, $r_2$, and $r_3$.  Let $g(x)=x^3+ax^2+bx+c$ be the polynomial which has roots $s_1$, $s_2$, and $s_3$, where
\begin{align*}
s_1 &= r_1+r_2z+r_3z^2, \\
s_2 &= r_1z+r_2z^2+r_3, \\
s_3 &= r_1z^2+r_2+r_3z,
\end{align*}and $z=\frac{-1+i\sqrt3}2$.  Find the real part of the sum of the coefficients of $g(x)$.
inference:
**SOLUTION**

**Step 1**:  Write down the sum of the coefficients of $g(x)$.
>  The sum of the coefficients of $g(x)$ is $a+b+c$.

**Step 2**:  Substitute $s_1$, $s_2$, and $s_3$ into the expressions for $r_1$, $r_2$, and $r_3$.
>  We have 
\begin{align*}
r_1 &= s_1-r_2z-r_3z^2, \\
r_2 &= s_2-r_1z-r_3, \\
r_3 &= s_3-r_1z^2-r_2.
\end{align*}

**Step 3**:  Substitute the expressions for $r_1$, $r_2$, and $r_3$ into the expression for $a+b+c$.
>  We get
\begin{align*}
a+b+c &= \sum_{i=1}^3(s_i-r_iz-r_iz^2)+b+\sum_{i=1}^3r_i z^i \\
&= \sum_{i=1}^3s_i-z\sum_{i=1}^3r_i-z^2\sum_{i=1}^3r_i+b+z+\sum_{i=1}^3r_iz^i \\
&= \sum_{i=1}^3s_i+z+\sum_{i=1}^3(r_i-z^ir_i-z^2r_i) \\
&= \sum_{i=1}^3s_i+z+\sum_{i=1}^3r_i(1-z-z^2) \\
&= \sum_{i=1}^3s_i+z+\sum_{i=1}^3r_i(1+z+z^2) \\
&= \sum_{i=1}^3s_i+z+\sum_{i=1}^3r_i0 \\
&= \sum_{i=1}^3s_i+z \\
&= (s_1+s_2+s_3)+z \\
&= (r_1+r_2z+r_3z^2)+(r_1z+r_2z^2+r_3)+ \\
&\qquad\qquad+(r_1z^2+r_2+r_3z)+z \\
&= r_1+(r_1+r_2+r_3)z+(r_1+r_2+r_3)z^2+z \\
&= r_1+(0)z+(0)z^2+z \\
&= r_1+z.
\end{align*}

**Step 4**:  Take the real part of $a+b+c$.
>  The real part of $a+b+c$ is $\boxed{\Re(r_1+z)}$.

**Step 5**:  Evaluate $\Re(r_1+z)$.
>  We have
\begin{align*}
\Re(r_1+z) &= \Re(s_1-r_2z-r_3z^2+z) \\
&= \Re(s_1-r_2z-r_3z^2)+\Re(z) \\
&= \Re(s_1)-\left(\Re(r_2)\Re(z)+\Im(r_2)\Im(z)\right) \\
&\qquad\qquad-\left(\Re(r_3)\Re(z^2)+\Im(r_3)\Im(z^2)\right)+\Re(z) \\
&= \Re(s_1)-\left(-\frac{1}{2}\cdot\frac{-1}{2}-\frac{\sqrt3}{2}\cdot\frac{\sqrt3}{2}\right)-\left(0-\frac{1}{2}\cdot\frac{\sqrt3}{2}\right)+\frac{1}{2} \\
&= \Re(s_1)+\frac{1}{2}.
\end{align*}

**Final Answer: $\boxed{\Re(r_1+z)= \Re(s_1)+\frac{1}{2}}$.**
ground_truth:
Note that $z^2 + z + 1 = 0$ and $z^3 = 1.$  Also, note that $s_2 = zs_1$ and $s_3 = z^2 s_1.$

The sum of the coefficients of $g(x)$ is
\begin{align*}
g(1) &= (1 - s_1)(1 - s_2)(1 - s_3) \\
&= (1 - s_1)(1 - s_1 z)(1 - s_1 z^2) \\
&= 1 - (1 + z + z^2) s_1 + (z + z^2 + z^3) s_1^2 - z^3 s_1^3 \\
&= 1 - s_1^3.
\end{align*}We have that
\[s_1^3 = r_1^3 + r_2^3 + r_3^3 + 3r_1^2 r_2 z + 3r_1^2 r_3 z^2 + 3r_2^2 r_3 z + 3r_2^2 r_1 z^2 + 3r_3^2 r_1 z + 3r_3^2 r_2 z^2 + 6r_1 r_2 r_3.\]Note that $r_1,$ $r_2,$ and $r_3$ are all real, and the real part of both $z$ and $z^2$ are $-\frac{1}{2},$ so the real part of $s_1^3$ is
\begin{align*}
&r_1^3 + r_2^3 + r_3^3 - \frac{3}{2} (r_1^2 r_2 + r_1 r_2^2 + r_1^2 r_3 + r_1 r_3^2 + r_2^2 r_3 + r_2 r_3^2) + 6r_1 r_2 r_3 \\
&= (r_1 + r_2 + r_3)^3 - \frac{9}{2} (r_1 + r_2 + r_3)(r_1 r_2 + r_1 r_3 + r_2 r_3) + \frac{27}{2} r_1 r_2 r_3 \\
&=3^3 - \frac{9}{2} (3)(-4) + \frac{27}{2} (-4) = 27.
\end{align*}Hence, the real part of the sum of the coefficients of $g(x)$ is $1 - 27 = \boxed{-26}.$

**SOLUTION**

**Step 1**:  Write down the sum of the coefficients of $g(x)$.
>  The sum of the coefficients of $g(x)$ is $a+b+c$.

**Step 2**:  Substitute $s_1$, $s_2$, and $s_3$ into the expressions for $r_1$, $r_2$, and $r_3$.
>  We have 
\begin{align*}
r_1 &= s_1-r_2z-r_3z^2, \\
r_2 &= s_2-r_1z-r_3, \\
r_3 &= s_3-r_1z^2-r_2.
\end{align*}

**Step 3**:  Substitute the expressions for $r_1$, $r_2$, and $r_3$ into the expression for $a+b+c$.
>  We get
\begin{align*}
a+b+c &= \sum_{i=1}^3(s_i-r_iz-r_iz^2)+b+\sum_{i=1}^3r_i z^i \\
&= \sum_{i=1}^3s_i-z\sum_{i=1}^3r_i-z^2\sum_{i=1}^3r_i+b+z+\sum_{i=1}^3r_iz^i \\
&= \sum_{i=1}^3s_i+z+\sum_{i=1}^3(r_i-z^ir_i-z^2r_i) \\
&= \sum_{i=1}^3s_i+z+\sum_{i=1}^3r_i(1-z-z^2) \\
&= \sum_{i=1}^3s_i+z+\sum_{i=1}^3r_i(1+z+z^2) \\
&= \sum_{i=1}^3s_i+z+\sum_{i=1}^3r_i0 \\
&= \sum_{i=1}^3s_i+z \\
&= (s_1+s_2+s_3)+z \\
&= (r_1+r_2z+r_3z^2)+(r_1z+r_2z^2+r_3)+ \\
&\qquad\qquad+(r_1z^2+r_2+r_3z)+z \\
&= r_1+(r_1+r_2+r_3)z+(r_1+r_2+r_3)z^2+z \\
&= r_1+(0)z+(0)z^2+z \\
&= r_1+z.
\end{align*}

**Step 4**:  Take the real part of $a+b+c$.
>  The real part of $a+b+c$ is $\boxed{\Re(r_1+z)}$.

**Step 5**:  Evaluate $\Re(r_1+z)$.
>  We have
\begin{align*}
\Re(r_1+z) &= \Re(s_1-r_2z-r_3z^2+z) \\
&= \Re(s_1-r_2z-r_3z^2)+\Re(z) \\
&= \Re(s_1)-\left(\Re(r_2)\Re(z)+\Im(r_2)\Im(z)\right) \\
&\qquad\qquad-\left(\Re(r_3)\Re(z^2)+\Im(r_3)\Im(z^2)\right)+\Re(z) \\
&= \Re(s_1)-\left(-\frac{1}{2}\cdot\frac{-1}{2}-\frac{\sqrt3}{2}\cdot\frac{\sqrt3}{2}\right)-\left(0-\frac{1}{2}\cdot\frac{\sqrt3}{2}\right)+\frac{1}{2} \\
&= \Re(s_1)+\frac{1}{2}.
\end{align*}

**Final Answer: $\boxed{\Re(r_1+z)= \Re(s_1)+\frac{1}{2}}$.**

ground_truth:
Note that $z^2 + z + 1 = 0$ and $z^3 = 1.$  Also, note that $s_2 = zs_1$ and $s_3 = z^2 s_1.$

The sum of the coefficients of $g(x)$ is
\begin{align*}
g(1) &= (1 - s_1)(1 - s_2)(1 - s_3) \\
&= (1 - s_1)(1 - s_1 z)(1 - s_1 z^2) \\
&= 1 - (1 + z + z^2) s_1 + (z + z^2 + z^3) s_1^2 - z^3 s_1^3 \\
&= 1 - s_1^3.
\end{align*}We have that
\[s_1^3 = r_1^3 + r_2^3 + r_3^3 + 3r_1^2 r_2 z + 3r_1^2 r_3 z^2 + 3r_2^2 r_3 z + 3r_2^2 r_1 z^2 + 3r_3^2 r_1 z + 3r_3^2 r_2 z^2 + 6r_1 r_2 r_3.\]Note that $r_1,$ $r_2,$ and $r_3$ are all real, and the real part of both $z$ and $z^2$ are $-\frac{1}{2},$ so the real part of $s_1^3$ is
\begin{align*}
&r_1^3 + r_2^3 + r_3^3 - \frac{3}{2} (r_1^2 r_2 + r_1 r_2^2 + r_1^2 r_3 + r_1 r_3^2 + r_2^2 r_3 + r_2 r_3^2) + 6r_1 r_2 r_3 \\
&= (r_1 + r_2 + r_3)^3 - \frac{9}{2} (r_1 + r_2 + r_3)(r_1 r_2 + r_1 r_3 + r_2 r_3) + \frac{27}{2} r_1 r_2 r_3 \\
&=3^3 - \frac{9}{2} (3)(-4) + \frac{27}{2} (-4) = 27.
\end{align*}Hence, the real part of the sum of the coefficients of $g(x)$ is $1 - 27 = \boxed{-26}.$
